skill.name: post-impl-docs
skill.description: Update repository documentation after code implementation. Maintains README, CHANGELOG, docs/ folder, and inline docstrings based on changes made. Triggered by lane-executor after task completion.
skill.summary: Update repository documentation after code implementation. Maintains README, CHANGELOG, docs/ folder...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: This skill only provides documentation generation capabilities and executes git commands to analyze changes. It has minimal security risk as it only reads git diffs and writes documentation files.

content.value_statement: Documentation falls out of sync with code. This skill automatically updates README, CHANGELOG, and docstrings based on git changes.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes git diffs to identify code changes
Updates README.md with new features and APIs
Scans docs/ folder for outdated references
Updates inline docstrings for modified functions
limitations: Requires git repository with commit history
Cannot detect semantic meaning of changes
Needs manual review for complex documentation

use_cases.title: Keep project docs current
use_cases.description: Automatically update README and CHANGELOG when merging pull requests

use_cases.title: Sync docs with releases
use_cases.description: Ensure documentation reflects latest API changes and features

use_cases.title: Maintain changelog hygiene
use_cases.description: Never forget to document changes with automated changelog entries

prompt_templates.title: Basic documentation update
prompt_templates.prompt: Run post-impl-docs to update documentation for the changes I just made

prompt_templates.title: Changelog only
prompt_templates.scenario: When you only want to update CHANGELOG
prompt_templates.prompt: Update CHANGELOG.md with the recent changes but skip README updates

prompt_templates.title: Docstring refresh
prompt_templates.prompt: Update all docstrings for the functions I modified in my last commit

prompt_templates.title: Full documentation sync
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all changes since last release and update README, CHANGELOG, and docs folder

output_examples.input: Update documentation for new authentication feature
output: ‚úì Added CHANGELOG entry: feat: Add JWT authentication

best_practices: Review all documentation changes before committing
Use conventional commits to improve CHANGELOG entries
Keep README focused on user-facing features only
Run the skill after each significant implementation
anti_patterns: Updating documentation without understanding the code changes
Adding changelog entries for trivial fixes like typos
Documenting internal implementation details in README
Forgetting to update docstrings when changing function signatures

faq.question: Which documentation files does it update?
faq.answer: README.md, CHANGELOG.md, files in docs/ folder, and inline docstrings in code files

faq.question: How does it detect what changes were made?
faq.answer: It analyzes git diff output to identify modified functions, classes, and public APIs

faq.question: Can it work with any changelog format?
faq.answer: It supports Keep a Changelog, Conventional Changelog, and simple bullet formats

faq.question: Is it safe to run on my repository?
faq.answer: Yes, it only reads git history and writes documentation files, never modifying code

faq.question: What if I don't want to update all documentation?
faq.answer: Use environment variables to control which files to update (UPDATE_README, UPDATE_CHANGELOG, etc.)

faq.question: Does it support multiple programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, Go, Rust, and other languages
